title.narrative: EQUITY-FOCUSED Early Child Development (ECD) & EDUCATION POLICIES

description.narrative: The Ministry of Education, Culture and Science's capacity to develop, budget, design and implement equity-focused, gender-sensitive policies, strategies, norms, requirements for early childhood development, primary and adolescent learning is enhanced., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Environmental Sustainability, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children benefit from increased access and utilization of educational services in a healthy, inclusive and quality learning environment.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Ministry of Education, Culture and Science’s capacity to develop, budget, design and implement equity-focused, gender-sensitive policies, strategies, norms, requirements for early childhood development, primary and adolescent learning is enhanced.

description.narrative: Knowledge generation and evidence-based policy making was strengthened through a conduct of UNICEF supported studies and reviews at both pre-primary and basic education levels, the results of which informed Education Sector Master Plan (ESMP) and other relevant policy documents. As part of ESMP process and as per UNICEF's continued advocacy and persistence, along with partner organizations such as UNESCO, the education sector coordination mechanism called “Local Education Group” was established under the leadership of MECSS to strengthen the collaboration and harmony of donor investment in the education sector. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019
